_prev_prog_2.FR_Comments: Original manufacturer of piping,valves,pump,totescomplied with applicable standards (ex.ASTMD1998-06
_prev_prog_2.EquipmentTested: HCl filters and transfer pumps (daily inspection)
_prev_prog_2.Description: Bulk liquid aqueous hydrochloric acid is stored in a bulk tote and pumped to stations to fill smaller containers. Bulk liquid totes and the smaller transfilled product containers (bottles or barrels) are stored in the main warehouse area.  Piping is in either double-containment or located within a spill control area and funneled to IWW spill containment via drains/trenches.

_exec_summary.SummaryText:
ter location has never had an accident involving the covered aqueous toxic liquid that caused deaths, injuries, property or environmental damage, evacuations, or sheltering in place.



Emergency Response Program

Air Liquide's Dallas Chemical Center location utilizes an Emergency Action Plan, Emergency Response, Standard Operating Procedures (SOPs), and operator training to ensure personnel are trained to identify and respond to accident and emergency situations.

Air Liquide's Dallas Chemical Center emergency response to accidental releases from the covered process includes: Stopping equipment operation and isolating any equipment which may leak fluid in addition to ensuring spill containment is handled according to safe practices. The Dallas Chemical Center is assisted by the Air Liquide Electronics US LP HAZMAT team.



Planned changes to improve safety

As is our policy at Air Liquide, we continue to review our process(es) for possible improvements to the process and  operational methods and evaluate new technology to lower risk. The Dallas Chemical Center conducts and resolves all findings from its PHA and other hazard reviews some of which result in modifications of the process. For example, process chemical inventory was reduced by eliminating the bulk HCl storage vessel.
